thread.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook: Fake news 'is one of today’s chief problems' (AAPL)
thread.title_full: Apple CEO Tim Cook: Fake news 'is one of today’s chief problems' (AAPL)

author: James Cook
title: Apple CEO Tim Cook: Fake news 'is one of today’s chief problems' (AAPL)
text:
print Apple CEO Tim Cook. Justin Sullivan/Getty Images 
Apple CEO Tim Cook has said in a new interview that the spread of fake news online "is one of today’s chief problems." 
Cook told Good Morning Britain that "we have to give the consumer tools to help with this and we've got to filter out part of it before it ever gets there without losing the great openness of the internet." 
The rise of misleading news has become a larger issue since the US election. Hundreds of misleading websites publish fake stories that can surface on social media and become popular. 
Cook described fake news as "one of today’s chief problems" in his interview with Good Morning Britain at a primary school in north London on Thursday. "It is not something that has a simple solution," he said. 
The Apple CEO has spent almost a week traveling around Europe . He has visited France, Germany, Scotland, and London, and has met with Prime Minister Theresa May and Mayor of London Sadiq Khan. 
Elsewhere in his interview with Good Morning Britain, Cook was asked about Brexit . He took a very optimistic tone, saying "the UK will be just fine." 
See Cook's full comments about fake news here: EXCLUSIVE: With fake news hitting the headlines, how does Apple boss @Tim_Cook think the issue should be dealt with? pic.twitter.com/kqF9scLzYh
